metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3672 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The arch_pick_mmap_layout function in arch/x86/mm/mmap.c in the Linux kernel through 4.5.2 does not properly randomize the legacy base address, which makes it easier for local users to defeat the intended restrictions on the ADDR_NO_RANDOMIZE flag, and bypass the ASLR protection mechanism for a setuid or setgid program, by disabling stack-consumption resource limits. Hector Marco and Ismael Ripoll discovered that the Linux kernel would improperly disable Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) for x86 processes running in 32 bit mode if stack-consumption resource limits were disabled. A local attacker could use this to make it easier to exploit an existing vulnerability in a setuid/setgid program.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
